[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The ReqView defines requirements for managing requirement documentation, traceability, and structured project data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ReqView supports requirement capture, traceability, review, and import/export.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ReqView runs in Chrome and Firefox on Windows, Linux, and Mac.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ReqView provides a GUI with menus and grids.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ReqView imports and exports Word and Excel via HTML, CSV.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ReqView operates offline, ensuring privacy without internet transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ReqView is optimized for handling large requirement sets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ReqView supports documentation, linking, filtering, reviewing, and exporting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ReqView is configurable for various documentation needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ReqView integrates with external tools via JSON.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ReqView enables users to create, manage, track, and analyze requirements.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ReqView is designed for project managers, analysts, engineers, and stakeholders.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ReqView does not provide built-in server-based collaboration; project files must be shared manually.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ReqView relies on standard browser environments without internet-based data transmission.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow users to create, open, and save requirement documents (REQ-PERF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support importing/exporting requirements to MS Word and Excel (REQ-PERF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to create, modify, and delete requirements (REQ-PERF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support MS Word and Excel file import and export (REQ-PERF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall establish traceability links between requirements (REQ-DB-22).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall enable searching, filtering, and sorting of requirements (REQ-PERF-004).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall generate reports and export data to CSV, HTML, and PDF (REQ-DB-58).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive user interface.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall open and process documents with up to 10,000 requirements within 10 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store requirement documents in JSON format.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain version history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall operate as a standalone application without requiring cloud services.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO/IEC/IEEE 29148 software requirements standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall allow encryption of requirement data.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Requirement traceability, import/export validation, and performance testing.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Software requirement documentation standards, traceability guidelines, and data export policies.
